name: GROTTO - Hackathon November 2023
description: Two engineers and myself teamed up to build an application in 48 hours that analyses a letter written to Santa and suggests environmentally sustainable Christmas presents (Group Project using NextJS, React, TailwindCSS, Supabase and Node.js)

name: Shufl.fm
description: A mobile application using machine-learning principles and test-driven-development (Jest/Supertest). We developed a regression model in Python to create our own neural network (no PyTorch!) to predict whether a user will like a song (Group project using Python, React-Native, PSQL and Node.js)

name: Nicks News
description: The frontend and backend for a news website featuring a REST API using TDD (React, PSQL, Node.js)

name: Word Hunt
description: A client-side word-hunt game in JavaScript developed using TDD (Jest) to practice algorithms such as depth-first search recursion and binary search. (Node.js)

name: Connect-4
description: A web-based Connect-4 game that included a bespoke AI using game-theory principles, in order for users to play against the computer (Python, Flask, Ajax, JS)

name: Spell-Checker
description: A program, written in C, that spell checks a file. This project included memory management and a personally designed hash table to reduce the running time (C). File available on request.

name: Data-Analyser (Work in Progress)
description: A .NET Application built with TDD (xUnit) that analyses large data sets using multi-threading for optimised performance (C#) (work in progress)
